org.hypknowsys.wumprep
Class WUMprepWrapper

java.lang.Object
  org.hypknowsys.wumprep.WUMprepWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class WUMprepWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class provides functionality for executing WUMprep Perl scripts from Java. It takes Instances via the push() method and sends them to the standard input of the wrapped Perl script. The script's output can be read via the PipedReaders available via getOutputPipe() and getErrorPipe(). This class is used by the filters in the package org.hypknowsys.wumprep4weka.filters.

Version:
$Id: WUMprepWrapper.html,v 1.6 2005/10/30 18:57:10 cpohle Exp $
Author:
Carsten Pohle (cp AT cpohle de)

private  class WUMprepWrapper.ScriptInputWriter
          Implements a thread for writing input from WUMprepWrapper.ScriptInputWriter.m_inputReader to a Perls script via WUMprepWrapper.ScriptInputWriter.m_inputWriter.
private  class WUMprepWrapper.ScriptOutputReader
          Implements a thread for reading a script's output from WUMprepWrapper.ScriptOutputReader.m_outputReader and sending it to WUMprepWrapper.ScriptOutputReader.m_outputWriter.

public WUMprepWrapper(java.lang.String scriptName,
                      java.lang.String args)
Crates a wrapper for executing a WUMprep Perl script in a subshell.

Parameters:
scriptName - The name of the WUMprep script to execute (the path relative to the WUMprep home directory returned by getWUMprepHome().
args - The arguments to be passed to the script.

perlInterpreter

public static java.lang.String perlInterpreter()
Get the full path to the Perl interpreter (either "perl.exe" or "perl"). The method first checks whether there exists an environment variable PERL_BIN. If PERL_BIN is not set, the method checks the directories defined in the PATH environment variable.

Returns:
The path to the Perl interpreter or null, if no Perl interpreter could not be found.

Saves the WUMprep installation directory in the Preferences storage.

Parameters:
wumPrepHome - The full path to the WUMprep installation directory on the local system.

getScriptOutputFormat

public weka.core.Instances getScriptOutputFormat(weka.core.Instances instanceInfo)
Creates a dummy dataset from the input format, sends it to the script and reads the script output's ARFF information that in turn is used to set this' output format. This mechanism allows a WUMprep script to alter the recordset layout as long as this change is documented by the output ARFF header. For example, the dnsLookup.pl script changes the host_ip field to host_dns when performing IP lookups.

Parameters:
instanceInfo - The input format.
Returns:
Object containing the output instance structure.

stop

public void stop()
This should stop the Perl script when the user (or whatever) interrupts KnowledgeFlow execution. At the moment, this does not seem to work!
